title.narrative: DATA AND SYSTEMS TO MONITOR CHILD RIGHTS

description.narrative: Government and civil society have the capacity to generate and use data and knowledge on child deprivation and disparities and to establish child rights monitoring and reporting structure., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Planning And Programme Reviews, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Child rights and gender equality prioritized in evidence-based public discourse, national policies, budget allocations, legislation, and social protection systems and progressively promoted and protected in social and cultural attitudes, practices and norms, with a focus on the most vulnerable

sector.narrative: Data analysis, including situation analysis and update

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents
